caption:
b'\xe2\x80\x9cThis year, Lloyds Banking Group announced a goal to help to reduce the carbon emissions they finance by more than 50% by 2030, working with customers, government and the market.

As part of this, they\xe2\x80\x99re supporting planting trees to help reduce the impact of climate change by absorbing carbon dioxide.  The partnership between Lloyds Banking Group and the @woodlandtrust will plant 10 million trees over 10 years, expanding the UK\xe2\x80\x99s carbon sink and contributing to reforesting the UK. These trees could absorb 2.5 million tonnes of carbon dioxide in their lifetime.

Since being founded in 1972 the Woodland Trust have planted over 50 million trees, and built an estate of over 1200 woods.  Every one of our woods are free to access for all, ensuring no one is excluded from experiencing the benefits of nature.

Our partnership planting schemes allow people across the UK to get involved. We\xe2\x80\x99re creating 10 new woodlands with volunteers from the Group, schools, and community groups planting the trees.  We\xe2\x80\x99re encouraging farmers to plant trees on their land through subsidised planting schemes, and in addition to this we\xe2\x80\x99ll be supplying over 500,000 free trees to schools and community groups to plant in their local area.

I\xe2\x80\x99m really proud of the work that I do as the Corporate Account Manager with the Lloyds Banking Group/Woodland Trust partnership.  I know that our partnership, and the work that our teams do, is making a real difference in the fight against climate change, as well as having a positive impact for wildlife and people across the UK.\xe2\x80\x9d 
- Judith, Corporate Account Manager at Woodland Trust

You can find out more about how your local school or community group can apply for free trees by visiting: https://www.woodlandtrust.org.uk/plant-trees/schools-and-communities 

#Sustainability #WoodlandTrust #ClimateChange #NationalTreeWeek'

b"We are working with @WoodlandTrust to create a cleaner and greener UK. Together, we've made a commitment to plant 10 million trees over the next decade and help farmers transition to a low carbon future.

By 2030, we'll reduce the carbon emissions we finance by more than 50% working with customers, government and the market.

#Sustainability #WoodlandTrust #ClimateChange #NationalTreeWeek"

b'Meet Judith. She is a Corporate Account Manager for the Woodland Trust, and works closely with us on our partnership to plant 10 million trees over the next decade, as part of our commitment to combat climate change and build a greener future for the UK :deciduous_tree: \n\n#Sustainability #WoodlandTrust #ClimateChange #NationalTreeWeek'

b'Our Breakthrough network and its programmes support and champion women to fulfil their career potential by creating an environment where they can access help and advice, while networking with other inspiring women. \n\n#GenderDiversity #WomenSupportingWomen #WomenInBusiness'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI began volunteering for Breakthrough, the Group\xe2\x80\x99s women\xe2\x80\x99s network, as a graduate. I joined the Steering Committee to represent our Emerging Talent engagement and wanted to ensure that other new joiners to the organisation got the same positive experience that I had.

Our Breakthrough Emerging Talent Working Group aimed to raise awareness of the network to new graduates and interns and did this through the creation of newsletters to signpost all of the support available through Breakthrough for new graduates and by attending graduate recruitment and induction events to encourage new joiners to sign up to the network.

Another responsibility I have on behalf of the Steering Committee is to organise the annual recognition events we hold for our volunteers that support the network. This is a great opportunity for us all to get together and celebrate the success of the network, strategically plan for where we can take the network next, and most crucially, say a huge thank you to all of the volunteers that support the activity each year. Whilst it takes a lot of organising, it\xe2\x80\x99s always one of the most engaging and fun events I attend each year and you can feel the buzz of energy and commitment from all of the colleagues in the room who are working towards the same goal.

This year, a number of our colleagues have faced additional challenges since the first lockdown in March. As a response to this, our Diversity networks have collaborated on a number of cross-network events throughout the year to reach more colleagues on each topic. I was delighted to lead on this activity on behalf of Breakthrough and we have supported some great events this year on topics including resilience and dealing with isolation.

I\xe2\x80\x99m really proud to be part of this network and feel really lucky to work in an organisation where so many like-minded people volunteer to support important activity like this.\xe2\x80\x9d \xe2\x80\x93 Gemma, Steering Committee member for Breakthrough

#LBGVoices #GenderDiversity #WomenSupportingWomen #WomenInBusiness'

b'Meet Gemma. She is part of our award-winning Breakthrough Network, working on initiatives that aim to help other women across the Group to develop and reach their full potential. \n\n#LBGVoices #GenderDiversity #WomenSupportingWomen #WomenInBusiness'

b"If you're struggling with your mental health, you can call the Samaritans
on 116 123 for free and confidential support. :telephone_receiver:

Presenting the \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s OK to Talk\xe2\x80\x99 session. Together with @lukeambleruk, mental health advocate and Founder of @andysmanclub, we\xe2\x80\x99re having conversations with colleagues about mental health and wellbeing."

b'Tomorrow is the second in our \xe2\x80\x9cIt\xe2\x80\x99s OK to talk\xe2\x80\x9d sessions. Tune in from 4pm!\n\nTogether with @lukeambleruk, mental health advocate and Founder of @andysmanclub, we\xe2\x80\x99re having conversations with colleagues about #MentalHealth and wellbeing.'

b'Presenting the first \xe2\x80\x98It\xe2\x80\x99s OK to Talk\xe2\x80\x99 session. Together with @lukeambleruk, mental health advocate and Founder of @andysmanclub, we\xe2\x80\x99re having conversations with colleagues about mental health and wellbeing.'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cDiwali is an annual festival, taking place between October and November. This year it falls on the 14th of November. For me, Diwali always means decorating the home with lights, dressing up in traditional clothes and enjoying delicious feasts with family and friends. I\xe2\x80\x99m very fond of some Diwali traditions like drawing \xe2\x80\x98Rangolis\xe2\x80\x99. These are beautiful patterns drawn on the floor by entrance of homes using coloured sand, rice or flower petals. They are believed to bring in prosperity and good luck to homes. I used to draw flowers and birds with my mother back in India and is a practice I still follow.

The history behind Diwali has different interpretations in different parts of India. In northern India, it is believed that King Rama returned to his kingdom Ayodhya along with his wife, Sita after defeating evil king, Ravana. The residents of Ayodhya welcomed them by lighting rows of clay lamps on the streets. In eastern India, people worship Goddess Kali, the destroyer of evil forces.

Every year we attend temples and other venues in north London to offer our prayers to Goddess Kali, following which there is always a party at home where we get together to exchange gifts and sweets with friends. Firework displays also form an integral part of Diwali celebrations, though they are gradually declining owing to environmental safety causes. 

Diwali will be different this year, but I\xe2\x80\x99m still looking forward to the virtual celebrations. We have already started decorating the home with fairy lights, candles, oil lamps and flowers. On the day of the festival, we will catch up with family and friends across the globe over Zoom calls.\xe2\x80\x9d - Devina, Chief Data Office

#LBGVoices #Diwali #HappyDiwali #Diwali2020'
b'Wishing a #Diwali that brings happiness, prosperity and joy to everyone celebrating :diya_lamp: \n\n#Diwali2020 #HappyDiwali'
b'Meet Devina, from our Chief Data Office. She tells us about Diwali and how she celebrates the festival :diya_lamp: \n\n#LBGVoices #Diwali #Diwali2020'

b'This is an uncertain time for everyone, including young people. To help, we\xe2\x80\x99re committed to supporting Bloom, from @mhealthuk. It\xe2\x80\x99s a programme delivered across the UK in schools, colleges and virtually to help young people build #MentalHealth resilience. \n\n#MentalHealthUK #MentalResilience #MentalHealthAwareness'
b'Meet Dee, she works in our Customer Financial Assistance team and is a Bloom reporter. Watch as she explains what Bloom from @mhealthuk is. \n\n#LBGVoices #MentalHealth #MentalHealthMatters'

b'"My whole life I have been surrounded by loved ones who have struggled with their mental health. This includes close friends, family, colleagues and even myself. 

For me, this started very early in life (around the age of 14) and, on reflection, I believe there is so much more that could be done in schools to help young people deal with their mental wellbeing in a more inclusive environment.

This is why I am so passionate about supporting @mhealthuk\xe2\x80\x99s Bloom programme; I think about how I felt at that stage and what a difference it might have made to understand more about my mental health and what was going on for me, and that's what Bloom is doing for young people now - helping them tap into their mental health resilience. 

I feel so proud to be spreading the word about Bloom; the programme is reaching more and more young people and training more teachers to support their students. I attended one of the online teacher training courses, which was fantastic. 

I have raised awareness of Bloom at work where many of my colleagues are parents; there are online resources from Bloom for parents to use to have conversations with their children on mental health. They found it particularly helpful during the pandemic, especially with all the stress around exams in the summer. 

It is so rewarding to know that I am playing a role in ensuring the resilience of young people is being built upon to help them cope in some of life's more challenging times - from friendships to decisions around the future. Remember 1 in 4 of us has experienced a mental health problem so be kind\xe2\x80\xa6 Always :smiling_face_with_smiling_eyes:\xe2\x80\x9d
- Dee, Customer Financial Assistance 

#LBGVoices #MentalHealth #MentalHealthUK'

b'"Becoming a dad for the first time instantly made me want to find a better balance between work and home. I\xe2\x80\x99d read, and heard, that #LloydsBankingGroup were a leading voice on flexible working and had passively kept an eye on roles and positions within the Group. 

When I applied, I had to be bold enough to tell my prospective employers how important it was to me to be a dad, and that the balance between life and work was the overriding factor in whether I could accept a role. It was an extremely difficult decision to leave a role I loved, and a risky choice to be so open with a new employer, so the choice of where to go and how much to say was vitally important for me and my new family. Of course, you can never be sure how much a policy is followed, and whether the reports you see and hear are an accurate reflection of reality. 

Thankfully, my experience from my first interview with the Group is that the policy is endorsed wholeheartedly, and my line manager and senior manager have been extremely supportive. 

People ask me what it\xe2\x80\x99s been like in the pandemic and my instant response is that I\xe2\x80\x99ve got nothing to complain about. We\xe2\x80\x99re healthy and safe and it means I\xe2\x80\x99ve been at home for most of my firstborn\xe2\x80\x99s second year, this has been an invaluable and a precious time to bond. It has, of course, also been a challenge. Patience has been tested to breaking point, joints are creaking, emails have been missed, hair has got greyer, work has been late, guilt has been rife, and there are bags under the eyes which shout \xe2\x80\x98new parent\xe2\x80\x99. 

The pandemic has been tough for everyone, but there have been some benefits. For me, I don\xe2\x80\x99t doubt that the pandemic, and the flexibility I have in my job, has meant I have a stronger relationship with my daughter than if I was still commuting and out of the house for long periods. This positive outweighs any negative, although it\xe2\x80\x99s difficult to remember that at 3am watching the Baby Club" - Sam, Head of Digital & dad

#LBGVoices'
b'We recognise the importance of family life and have invested in creating one of the best packages for working parents in the UK. \n\n#AgileWorking #FlexibleWorking #WorkingFamilies #WorkingParents'

b'Meet Sam. He joined the Group shortly after his daughter has born, being able to benefit from our Agile working policies to find balance between work and home life. \n\n#LBGVoices #AgileWorking #WorkLifeBalance'
b'We\xe2\x80\x99ve made a commitment to be a leader in gender diversity. Here\xe2\x80\x99s some of our journey so far.\n\n#GenderDiversity #GenderEquality'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cMyself and my Husband had talked about becoming Foster Carers for a number of years and at the start of 2020 we decided to explore this further.\xe2\x80\xaf After the initial meeting with our Local Authority it was clear that this was something we felt strongly about and we discussed it with our own children who were onboard with wanting to give something back as a family.\xe2\x80\xaf 

I feel really proud to say that I can help some of the most vulnerable children in our society whilst still delivering in my day job and continuing to pursue my own professional development, I\xe2\x80\x99m currently studying for my Chartered Banker by Experience qualification to support my future career progression within Lloyds Banking Group.\xe2\x80\xaf 

Being able to strike the right work/life balance is incredibly important to me and the support that I\xe2\x80\x99ve received through the company, my line manager and from my Husband (who is always my rock in everything that I do) has been vital to me achieving this.\xe2\x80\xaf 

I\xe2\x80\x99m a very proud and determined woman and want to be the best version of me \xe2\x80\x93 whether that\xe2\x80\x99s delivering a meeting or cleaning the windows at home :smiling_face_with_smiling_eyes: - I like to think that I\xe2\x80\x99m role modelling good values and behaviours to my children and am teaching them to have a strong work ethic too.\xe2\x80\x9d 

- Sara, Area Support Manager & Foster Carer 

#LBGVoices #GenderDiversity #FosterCaringSavesLives'

b'Meet Sara. She is an Area Support Manager for Lloyds Banking Group, a Wife, a Mum of two and an active Foster Carer. Colleagues like Sara are key to our commitment to being a leader in gender diversity.\n\n#LBGVoices #GenderDiversity #Fosteringsaveslives'

b'This week, you\xe2\x80\x99ve heard from Roland who will play a key role in delivering our Race Action Plan, creating meaningful change across the Group. 

At #LloydsBankingGroup, we stand against discrimination in all its forms and have been striving for inclusion and equality. But we can and will do better.
#BlackHistoryMonth #BHM2020 #InclusionMatters'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cThe past two months have been emotional, challenging and at times draining, that said I now feel hopeful. 

The Black community has continued to face into injustice, inequality, and pain. The shooting of Jacob Blake in the US, COVID-19 cases on the rise again and the tragic death of Chadwick Boseman aka Black Panther, the first Black superhero and one of my role models. 

Within Lloyds Banking Group, the announcement of the Race Action Plan on the 16th July was a historic milestone in our timeline. A massive statement of intent that as an organisation we stand against racism and we are taking steps to drive sustainable change. 

I\xe2\x80\x99m pleased to say that I\xe2\x80\x99ve accepted a new role which will see me lead the delivery of this important plan. 

I know it\xe2\x80\x99s not going to be easy and it may feel uncomfortable at times however this is our time to do what is right. Above anything else I\xe2\x80\x99m excited about what we\xe2\x80\x99ll achieve. 

What drives me is that this is about changing lives for the better, delivering sustainable change not just for my generation, but also for my kids generation where they don\xe2\x80\x99t have to face into the challenges myself and other Black colleagues have faced in their lives. 

I will continue to gather and understand the feedback of our Black colleagues. We\xe2\x80\x99ve already been doing this through our virtual focus group listening sessions however we need to do more. Listening is key but of course it\xe2\x80\x99s what we do with that listening that\xe2\x80\x99s important. 

This month is #BlackHistoryMonth, where we\xe2\x80\x99ll be celebrating Black excellence. Changing the narrative associated with the Black community by recognising and amplifying the achievements of Black people, not just in the world of sport and entertainment but also in other areas such as business and science. 

This is just the beginning, and we have lots to do! There will be lots more to come for the wider organisation in terms of how we continue to set the tone, keep the conversation going and get more comfortable talking about race. Importantly we\xe2\x80\x99ll be addressing all aspects of inequality with positive action and striving for fair representation.\xe2\x80\x9d 

-Roland, Race Action Plan lead 

#BHM2020 #LBGVoices'

b'Meet Roland. He\xe2\x80\x99s our newly appointed Race Action Plan lead, who will sit on our Race Advisory Panel made up of 20 colleagues of Black, Asian and Ethnic Minority Heritage to influence and inform our ongoing diversity strategy and ensure we are making the right progress. \n\n#LBGVoices #BlackHistoryMonth #BHM2020 #InclusionMatters'

b'Meet Dan. He is the Rainbow Network Pride Lead and was responsible for creating a virtual Pride plan for Lloyds Banking Group in 2020, offering our community a safe and accepting environment to celebrate who they are. \n\n#LBGVoices #Pride #LGBT+ #pride:rainbow:'

b"Pride celebrations looked a lot different this year, but that didn't stop the LGBT+ community and allies finding other ways to mark the occasion. Here's how we celebrated.\n\n#Pride #pride2020:rainbow_flag_selector: #LGBT+ #LloydsBankingGroup"

b'\xe2\x80\x9cIf I think back to when I was 17, a small town boy shaking in my mum\xe2\x80\x99s car as I was about to come out, and who had never really met other people who were Iike me who I could relate to or talk to, things are a world away from that now. I wouldn\xe2\x80\x99t have believed the journey that I would go on with Lloyds Banking Group or that I would be involved in organising our LGBT+ initiatives as Rainbow Pride lead.

I love our LGBT+ network and what it has to offer.  It\xe2\x80\x99s opened my eyes to issues I never even realised were still an issue and I\xe2\x80\x99ve learned so much about our community. It\xe2\x80\x99s also supported me in ways I never realised I needed. The most important part of the network at Lloyds Banking Group for me is the fact it\xe2\x80\x99s driven by colleagues and their thoughts and beliefs and we\xe2\x80\x99re given a platform for us all to shine, as well as a safe and inclusive place to work. So I can honestly say, I\xe2\x80\x99ve reached the point now where I am \xe2\x80\x98Always Proud\xe2\x80\x99 \xe2\x80\x93 rainbow trainers in tow of course, and being part of the network I feel more empowered than ever to ensure that people know LBG is a true ally of the LGBT+ community.

That said there\xe2\x80\x99s always more we can do. Last year for example, I saw the Rainbow flag at Pride that included colours to represent Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic as well as Trans communities. I had always thought that the rainbow flag was all-encompassing, but when my friend Anthony, told me about the marginalisation these sections of our communities can still feel under the wider LGBT+ umbrella, I knew that we had more work to do.

So this year, we recreated our Rainbow network logo with those extra stripes, and celebrated Pride virtually with a series of events for colleagues spanning 10 weeks to recognise 10 years of the Rainbow network. We are an inclusive company and we want all people, customers and colleagues, to know that whoever they are, we are supportive and here to represent them. It\xe2\x80\x99s the perfect way for us as a company to celebrate the 10 year anniversary of our Rainbow Network and look forward to the next decade \xe2\x80\x93 and beyond! \xe2\x80\x93 of LGBT+ progress in the workplace.\xe2\x80\x9d 

- Dan, Rainbow Network Pride Lead

:camera_with_flash: credit: @gaytimes 

#LBGVoices #Pride #LGBT+'

b'Ensuring the values and diversity of our workforce reflect that of our customer is crucial for us. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we continue to grow our REACH (Race, Ethnicity and Cultural Heritage) Network.\n\n#LloydsBankingGroup #BlackHistoryMonth #Inclusion #Diversity #InclusionMatters'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI became a volunteer of the REACH (Race, Ethnicity & Cultural Heritage) network whilst on the Lloyds Banking Group graduate scheme and have continued to be involved ever since. REACH aims to support members to realise their full potential and achieve their aspirations, while promoting an ethnically and culturally diverse workforce. It\xe2\x80\x99s something I support alongside my role that is very rewarding and opens up many opportunities to meet different people across the Group with varying cultures and backgrounds; and as a Black female it\xe2\x80\x99s so important to me to work in an environment that is inclusive and enables me to bring my whole self to work. 

Initially I joined the network supporting with our regular communications e.g. newsletters and blogs, however, I started to get more involved with events and signature initiatives such as our Black History Month campaigns. Last year, I took part in various conversations and activity that focussed on sharing the need and importance of increasing Black representation at senior levels within the organisation. 

This year the Group introduced the Race Action Plan and committed to increasing Black representation at senior level to at least 3% by 2025. I am so pleased that the Group have made a public commitment to reaching this goal and supporting Black colleagues with progression within the organisation which will complement the overall Black, Asian and Ethnic Minority targets. 
I feel really proud and honoured to be part of the many changes that are to come across the Group.\xe2\x80\x9d 

- Chanae, REACH Network Volunteer

#LBGVoices #BlackHistoryMonth #DiversityandInclusion'

b'Meet Chanae. She is part of our REACH (Race, Ethnicity & Cultural Heritage) Network, working on initiatives that aim to promote an ethically and culturally diverse culture within the Group. \n\n#LBGVoices #BlackHistoryMonth #DiversityandInclusion #Diversity #InclusionMatters'

b'\xe2\x80\x9cI\xe2\x80\x99ve led our property design team for almost a year now, and it\xe2\x80\x99s a job I really love. I get a lot of fulfilment from our purpose to reduce the carbon footprint of our buildings and support our colleagues to make sustainable changes. I\xe2\x80\x99ve made some new habits of my own recently, like taking the train rather than flying and eating less meat. This job lets me multiply the potential impact of those actions by 65000 by supporting others to make changes to how they live and work.

My team play a simple but critical role within our broader sustainability strategy, demonstrating our commitment to take action on our own carbon footprint.

This year, the Group announced a truly impactful goal to help reduce the carbon emissions we finance by more than 50% by 2030. A goal of that scale, working with our 26 million customers, takes our influence to another level. My team have the opportunity to show those 26 million customers, in particular those who own businesses, how they can take action on their own carbon footprint.

I feel really proud that the Group is investing so much time in taking action against climate change, and really support our stance that businesses that can move faster and go further should do so.\xe2\x80\x9d

Naomi, Head of Property Design

#LBGVoices'

b"A sustainable and responsible approach to doing business is integral to everything we do. That's why, since January 2019, 100% of our global electricity demand has come from renewable sources. #FinancingAGreenFuture\n\n#Sustainability #SustainableBusiness #RenewableEnergy"
b'Meet Naomi. She leads a team responsible for making our buildings and our colleagues more environmentally sustainable.\n\n#Sustainability #SustainableBusiness #SustainabilityMatters #LBGVoices'
b'We know the importance of having good #MentalHealth. That\xe2\x80\x99s why we\xe2\x80\x99ll train 2,500 colleagues as Mental Health Advocates by the end of 2021.'

b'"I grew up surrounded by yoga but also meditation. My father would meditate daily and I loved sitting with him \xe2\x80\x93 I always felt so peaceful and connected to my thoughts and feelings so as I grew older and \xe2\x80\x9clife happened\xe2\x80\x9d I continued to explore the many aspects of yoga. For me, yoga is my way of life \xe2\x80\x93 it\xe2\x80\x99s what I eat, drink sleep and breathe. It helps me make decisions and have a perspective to everything in life \xe2\x80\x93 even COVID-19!"

Niki, one of our Mental Health Advocates has helped colleagues by running virtual Yoga sessions during lockdown in partnership with our gender diversity network, Breakthrough. 

"From day one of lockdown, I had requests to run yoga and meditation classes online both through colleagues and via friends & family on social media. It demonstrated how important it was to manage our health and wellbeing during this time. 

I was acutely aware of my own role in the Group and how it wasn\xe2\x80\x99t impacted as much as all the key workers supporting colleagues and customers. I responded to the internal request from Breakthrough and agreed with them to host yoga sessions and make them available for all LBG colleagues. We ran the first session on the 25th March and there was a huge response! 

Since lockdown I have the blessing of time so I've spent more time each day exploring my ever changing feelings and emotions from day to day. Breathing through anxiety has been especially helpful for me \xe2\x80\x93 we've all had to make changes to our lives to get through a time in which we all experienced worry, stress or panic in some way. 

It\xe2\x80\x99s important to recognise what we\xe2\x80\x99re feeling and have coping strategies to help keep us calm \xe2\x80\x93 for me it\xe2\x80\x99s closing my eyes and breathing." :woman_in_lotus_position_selector: 

#LBGVoices #MentalHealth #yoga'

b'Meet Niki. As one of our Mental Health Advocates, she is responsible for encouraging colleagues to be open about their own mental health and ensuring they have access to the support they need. #MentalHealth #MentalHealthAtWork #MentalHealthAdvocate #LBGVoices'

b'Welcome to the Instagram channel for #LloydsBankingGroup, where we\xe2\x80\x99ll show you how our colleagues are helping people, businesses and communities across the UK.\n\nFrom tomorrow, we\xe2\x80\x99ll introduce you to our #LBGVoices - passionate and dedicated colleagues from across the Group who are working to make a real difference.'

b'We serve more than 26 million customers and over a million businesses, but we want to go beyond business as usual and help address the social, economic and environmental issues that matter most to Britain. \n\n#LloydsBankingGroup'
b'We are Lloyds Banking Group. Follow us to see how we\xe2\x80\x99re #HelpingBritainProsper :horse: \n\n#LloydsBankingGroup'
